text: hey guys I'm Alex thanks for clicking
and welcome to this lesson on simple
phrasal verbs this is a beginner lesson
for those of you who are just starting
to learn English and use some basic
expressions so a phrasal verb is a verb
plus a preposition that come together to
create a phrase a small unit of meaning
a verb expression so today we will look
at some very basic phrasal verbs to help
you speak confidently and clearly in
English the first verb I have first
phrasal verb I have is wake up wake up
so in the morning you know you're
sleeping you are in bed and then you
wake up and you wake up when you open
your eyes in the morning so for example
I wake up at 6 a.m. every day what time
do you wake up now the past tense of
wake up so for example I wake up at 6
a.m. every day but this morning I woke
up at 6:30 a.m. so the past of wake up
is woke up woke up okay so we have wake
up then we have get up okay they're very
close but not the same so for example I
wake up at 6 a.m. but maybe I'm tired
and I look at the alarm clock and I say
no no not yet not yet
ok so after 15 minutes maybe 30 maybe
one hour you decide ok it's time to get
up so when you get up you get out of
your bed ok
so for example I get up at 6:15 every
day so maybe I wake up at 6 a.m. but I
get up at 6:15
okay the past of get up so again I get
up at 6:15 every day but today I got up
at 6:40 so the past of get up is got up
okay the next to turn on turn off very
simple so you can turn on usually a
machine some kind of electrical device
so in this situation we have could you
turn on the light please turn on the
light you can turn on a computer or turn
on a car or turn on a machine basically
okay now we have turn off which is the
opposite turn on on it's working turn on
the TV turn off turn off the TV so for
example don't forget to turn off your
laptop okay now these are regular verbs
so turn is a regular verb so the past of
turn on and turn off is turned on turned
off plus e d and finally two very simple
phrasal verbs sit down and stand up so
everyone understands sit sit stand stand
we can also say sit down right sit down
stand up okay so please sit down in the
class the past of sit sit down is she
hmm beside me okay she sat down she sat
down beside me okay sorry about my
writing guys its SAT she sat down beside
me and stand the past of stand is stood
so we say everyone stood up when he
entered when he came into the room so
maybe when the judge or the
president entered the room everybody
stood up okay okay guys so please if you
want to check out more information and
practice these phrasal verbs check out
the quiz on an vidcom good luck and take
care
you
